attributes.action: Massively Improve and Invest in Technology for Primary Public Services
attributes.additional_details:
British industry continues to innovate, so doesn’t technology. Why is it that our public services don’t seem to keep up? 

Having had insight working in a hospital, I can say that there doesn’t seem to be much innovation and where there is, it is typically only for a small portion of the country. We don’t seem to innovate. Why not use drones in the police force or in the coastguard? Or even go as far to introduce an Estonian style e-police system? Why not send emergency messages via text?
attributes.background: Technology in our current public services including the NHS, Police, Ambulance and Coastguard are becoming outdated with little space for improvement. Make it easier and more efficient to report incidents to police, and innovate in creative uses of technology in the frontline services.
